sentences.sContent: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.sCn: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

sentences.sContent: ...But current studies are beginning to place greater emphasis on the conditions under which we forget...
...it is high time that both hospitals and patients should take some steps to deal with current poor relationship...
...It is calculated by estimating the share of a company's value that cannot be accounted for by its current products and cash flow...
...You may need to start by encouraging your current network to help you identify your blind spots...
...and current data indicates that 2013 is likely to have been the fourth hottest year on record...
...She reports the current political news for her paper...
...although the current emphasis on preparing young Americans for STEM science...
...In March its chief executive was fired by Time's current Man of the Year...
...Only Ford may survive in its current form...

...The pervasive undervaluation on elementary skills that we find among current students and even some teachers can largely be attributed to their lack of vision of future and thorough understanding on the knowledge...
...What I mean by that is the current perspective of the digital textbook is it's an exact copy of the print book...
...among the photos of current faculty members and students...
...Millions of American families may now be in the initial stage of their responses to the current crisis...
...and the current crisis will probably do the same...
...No current merit-aid recipients will lose their scholarships...
...there are scholarships for current college students with exceptional grades as well...

synos.tran: 现在的；流通的，通用的；最近的；草写的
